titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:17-0400

did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings of elicited vocabulary, pronunciation, and some grammar in the Columbia-Wenatchi language, often referred to on the recording as Moses. Includes occasional vocabulary in the Colville dialect of the Okanagan language. Recorded near in the Methow Valley south of Carlton, Washington, in June - August 1965.
did.physdesc: 6 sound tape reels (7 hr., 44 min.) : analog, 3 3/4 ips, 2 track, mono ; 5 in. and 7 in.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by M. Dale Kinkade in 1966. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Elicited vocabulary in the Columbia-Wenatchi language--often referred to on the recording as Moses--with occasional vocabulary in the Colville dialect of the Okanagan language. Recorded in the Methow Valley, south of Carlton, Washington.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
